title: Gas Chromatography Detection Protocol of Short-chain Fatty Acids in Mice Feces
procedures:
Sample collectionSelect mice in similar growth status at 6-8 weeks.Collect fecal samples from 12 mice, approximately 300 mg per sample (stored at -20 °C). Used for the determination of SCFAs and recovery.Mix 12 samples fully, weigh about 100 mg of the mixed sample and place it in a 5 ml centrifuge tube. Repeat the weighing of the 22 samples. Use three of them to test SCFAs in parallel, and use the remaining 19 to determine the rate of recovery. Number and record the sample quality (stored at -20 °C).Sample pretreatmentKeep all biological samples frozen at -20 °C until the day of analysis.Add 3 ml HCl 1 M to each sample, vortex for 1 min, mix thoroughly until no obvious clumping.Place the well-mixed centrifuge tube in an ice-water bath in the beaker, and conduct ultrasonic extraction for 10 min (see Video 1). Set the temperature to room temperature and the frequency is 40k Hz.

Video 2. Extraction Centrifuge the sample at 4 °C, 9,710 x g for 15 min.Aspirate the supernatant with disposable sterile syringe and filter through a 0.22 μm organic filter membrane. Transfer the filtered supernatant to Clear short thread wide mouth sample bottle, and inject into GC for analysis (If the sample stored in the bottle cannot be analyzed as soon as possible, it can be stored at -20 °C for 1-2 days) (see Figure 2). imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/20200702/20200702022239_1472.jpgFigure 2.
